description: Lenart Kova formally proposes a monitored citywide referendum to the Council, arguing it could channel unrest into an orderly process. The Council reluctantly approves, seeking to regain control amid mounting divisions.

The Council publicly announces the referendum. Citizens are invited to choose between restoring the BCI system or continuing community-led self-organization. Lenart assists in setting up voting systems with monitored digital channels.

District assemblies and televised forums highlight stark divides: some neighborhoods push for BCI restoration, while others are inspired by 'vanished' citizen networks. Voting turnout is high, with new voices shaping debate.
A closely-watched voting process ends. Vanished citizens openly verify results in several districts, forcing the Council to acknowledge their active presence in public life for the first time.

Results show a narrow majority supporting ongoing local self-organization over BCI. The Council concedes publicly, but tensions rise as some districts align with vanished leaders and power struggles intensify behind the scenes.
